Once upon a time  I was a little girl I had no friends, and my mother died when I was three years old. My father left me with the care of two sisters who were very kind to me, but they never cared for me as much as they did their brothers. One day, while we were playing in the garden, one of them came up to us and said, "Don't you know that your brother is dead?" "Yes." "And he has been buried here since then." "But why do you think he's still alive?" "Because his sister lives here." "She's not living here anymore." "No, she isn't." "I don't believe it!" "What are you saying?" "I'm telling you the truth." "You can't be lying to me." "Why would I lie?" Because you're afraid of what people will say about you if you tell the truth. But that's just nonsense! You have to trust yourself. If you want to live, you'll have to face everything alone. And it's better to face things alone than to hide behind someone else's lies. That's how life works. It's all right. You're going to get through this. You'll find out soon enough. Thank you

The wind blew in from the south, bringing with it the smell of salt water. My eyes were filled with tears as I watched the waves crash against the rocks. Suddenly, I heard a voice calling me back home. "Back home!" I cried out. "Back home! Where are you going?" he asked. "I don't know." "But where do you think you're going? I saw her face. It was so beautiful! The sun shone through it and made it shine even brighter. I couldn't believe that I had seen her once before. And then I heard her voice calling out for me. My heart began to beat faster. And I knew that I would never be able to forget her. Soon after that, I went back to school. And every morning I would go there with my father. He'd always tell me stories about his childhood. One day he told me about how he used to play hide-and-seek. When he found someone hiding behind a tree, he would shout, "Hey!" And if anyone answered him, he'd yell, "Stop hiding!" And they'd run away from each other. And when they were finally caught, they'd get into a fight. And sometimes they'd end up fighting over who got first. But at least they could laugh together. And that's what I wanted to do as well.

Once upon a time  there was a man who had two wives. One of them was his wife, and the other one he loved very much. But she was so beautiful that he couldn't bear to see her without feeling jealousy. So he made up some stories about her and told them all over the town, and then when they were done, he took off his hat and went out into the street and said, "Now I know what it is to be married."  And as soon as he got outside, he saw this lovely woman standing by the side of the road with her face turned away from him.  "What do you want?" asked the man.  "I am looking for my wife," answered the woman.  "And where is she?" asked the man again.  "Oh!" replied the woman, "I don't know; but I'll tell you something if you will promise not to ask me any more questions."  The man promised, and after a while came back to find his wife in the same position as before.  "Well," said he, "you are sure you've found your wife?" Once upon a time  there was a man who lived in the city of New York City. He had a wife and two children. He loved his family very much, but he also wanted to be independent. He didn't want to live with his parents or grandparents because they were too old for him. He wanted to live alone. His mother died when he was young so he moved away from home. He went on to find work as an engineer. He worked hard and earned money enough to support himself and his family. But he still needed more money. He decided to sell his house. He sold it and bought a new one. He then started working again. He got married again and had another child. He lived happily ever after. Nowadays, we have lots of people living in large cities like New York City. They are rich and famous. However, many of them don't know how to manage their own lives. Many of them are dependent on others for everything. This is called dependency syndrome. The problem is that this kind of thinking doesn't help you achieve your goals.
